body.p:
Frankfort Ky
Apl 14. 64
To your Excellency
Gov. Bramblet

Dr. Sir. please allow me to drop you a feiw lines on being discharged from the military appointment of Deputy Police I was recomended to Col. Edwards by four letters written by Cols Garrot & Brown General Harlin and Capt H. I. Todd Major Mahony and several others the above letters was given me some months ago to visit Genl Fry. I done so. they were entirely satisfactory but there was nothing I felt competant to undertake at his hand as I dislike to botch business this I do to show your Excellency the grounds for my appointment by Col Edwards I complied strictly with the
the work Contained in the appointment to the 7 april at which my time expired I was directed to report to Genl. Lindsey I done so I Hunted up some six soldiers one new saddle and a number of arms delivered them over to the quartermaster those arms have heretofore been drawn and not returned of which there are plenty yet out Some of the above soldiers have been absent from their regiments seven months and in this time I have sons in the federal service they would not be favorites nor screaned by me acting in a military capacity tis true we have a deputy marshal here he may do all that is proper to do -- even on that matter I say no more Your Excellency might ask how
He obtained his appointment it was obtained through his father-in-law Capt Martin of Lexington, who was intimate with the marshal of that place without a word against Capt Shuts I tell your Excellency there are deserters from both armies through our county and very often in our town

N B.. and now governor you verry properly might want to no what I have done that entiles me to ask the military authorities for favor as brief as possilbe I will tell you I have enlisted moore men In the service than another man in town or county I have give moore to the families of soldiers than any ten men in the town and do not regret it but I was bridge keeper here and burnt out by the rebels.
from my salary also robed of a fine horse & saddle giving me a trifle for him that or nothing to the latter part of this it will be signed

In regard to Mr Finnel chairity to Soldiers, and Soldier wifes I can state that he to the best of my knowledge bought at different ^times^ this unhapy war commenced one hundred and fifty dollars of me for the benefit of the government --
Mr. Finel has bought many articals from me for Soldiers and there familiys and I think as good a Union man as any in town

John J. Lewis
I witnessed ^the^ abov with in on Several occassions
John Whitehead
Grocer, Merchant
